Sentence: Brint brings up the name Paul Delmonte, whom Adam does not know
Adam asks if he (Adam) is the gray man, and says that when he (Adam) was brought up earlier, he (Adam) was bluffing when he (Adam) told Brint he (Adam) did not want to talk about Paul
He (Adam) actually does not know who Paul is
With Brint, Adam says that his (Adam) father told him (Adam) his (Adam) real name was Paul Delmonte that that Adam Farmer was a fabrication
(Adam/AdamFarmer)', 'The doctor calls him (Adam) Paul, and Adam wonders who that is
